examples: the raiders fed the guard dog to keep it quiet
he fed her brownies he had just baked

verb.description: Supply (a machine) with material, power, or other things necessary for its operation.
examples: the programs are fed into the computer

verb.description: Supply water to (a body of water)
examples: the pond is fed by a small stream
water feeds into the lower pool

verb.description: Insert further coins into (a meter) to extend the time for which it operates.

examples: I think he is feeding his old employer commercial secrets
you were still in the wings feeding Micky his lines

verb.description: (in ball games) pass (the ball) to a player.
examples: he took the ball and fed Salley

verb.description: Distribute (a broadcast) to local television or radio stations via satellite or network.
examples: programs that the national networks feed to local stations

verb.description: Cause to move gradually and steadily, typically through a confined space.
examples: make holes through which to feed the cables

noun.description: An act of giving food, especially to animals or a baby, or of having food given to one.
examples: I've just given the horse her feed

noun.description: A device or conduit for supplying material to a machine.
examples: the plotter has a continuous paper feed

noun.description: A line or prompt given to an actor on stage.

phrases: That undertone in the woman's voice put Lee off his feed instantly.
Otherwise, watching them might have put him off his feed.
I know when you're off your feed and I've had a few babies myself.
Sometimes when I'm off my feed and not feeling up to polite society it's better for me to have something in my hands.
Even if I haven't had any of it, the very thought is almost enough to put me off my feed.
what the audience tells me feeds back into my work
Next, you will need to practice diligently a number of exercise techniques to get feed back while developing these abilities.
Based on this feed back and a low response rate, this item was revised for the third mailing.
We did not feed back to respondents their previous score.
Consumers also play a role in the innovation process of creative industries by their willingness to pay for a new style, which feeds back to influence production and distribution structures.
origin: Old English fēdan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch voeden and food.
